title: Leone de Castris 2016 Five Roses Rosato (Salento)
description: Underripe strawberry and watermelon tones carry the nose and palate, with Mediterranean shrubs in the background. Medium in weight, with a nice balance of acidity, cranberry-skin tannins offer support from start to finish.

title: Leone de Castris 2016 Villa Santera  (Primitivo di Manduria)
description: Jammy red fruit aromas mix with floral and sweet spice undertones on the nose. Medium in weight, with gentle acidity, the palate bursts with red berry flavors and notes of anise and mint.

title: MAN Family Wines 2015 Bosstok Pinotage (Coastal Region)
description: A touch shy upon first sniff, this wine opens up more with time to reveal bright aromas of brambly berry, raspberry and cherry, all hit by a decent dusting of cinnamon. The medium-weight palate is straightforward and approachable, with moderate tannins and a mouthwatering finish that leaves the palate refreshed. Drink now.

title: Messina Hof 2016 Riesling Father and Son Cuvée Riesling (Texas)
description: Mango, cantaloupe and lychee shine on the nose, with subtler hints of grass and peach blossom. This wine is simple and pleasant in its flavors of melon, orange zest and fresh cut grass, ending on a juicy orange note.

title: Mont Marçal 2016 Brut Rosado Sparkling (Cava)
description: Cantaloupe and stone-fruit aromas of this Trepat-based Cava are clean but basic. That also describes the palate, which is good but a bit soft and low on acidity, with some dry orange flavors.

title: Montemar Wines 2014 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A very reductive take on the grape, this bottling shows lawn cuttings, guava skin, tangy green orange pith on the nose, but also hints of an oily underlying structure. Those aromas come together on the palate, with dried grass and citrus skins proving rather pungent.

title: Nessa 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Pear and melon aromas are good but basic. Citric acidity is grabbing, while citrus and peach flavors show a hint of green pepper on the backside. On the finish, the fruit character doesn't last long. Drink immediately.

title: Old Soul 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Aromas of charred wood and black pepper meet concentrated flavors of black cherry and blackberry in this full-bodied wine. A hint of sweetness rounds its edges on the palate and gives a jammy note to the finish.

title: Omero 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Barrel fermented in 20% new French oak, using indigenous yeasts, this is soft and supple, with a sense of impending oxidation. Bruised apples and pears constitute the fruit, and it should be consumed over the next year or two.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Negre de Negres Red (Priorat)
description: Medicinal, rubbery aromas suggest earthy berry, compost and latex. This Grenache-Carignan-Syrah blend feels baked and chunky but not fully defined. Roasted dark-berry flavors finish heavy and without finesse.

title: Rocca delle Macìe 2016 Campo Maccione Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with aromas of citrus, yellow peach and a whiff of pineapple. The linear, slightly lean palate offers grapefruit, tangerine and a touch of bitter almond.

title: Rosemont NV Virginia Red (Virginia)
description: Bright aromas of strawberry, lavender, violets and rooibos are met with cedar and ginger. These carry through to the palate where an element of charred wood is introduced. Ample acidity and a mid-weight body offer a nice mouthfeel and a long, woody finish.

title: San Marzano 2014 Annivesario 62 Riserva  (Primitivo di Manduria)
description: A wealth of oak tones—wood, vanilla and cocoa—ride over a core of cherry jam. The full-bodied palate follows suit, with pillowy tannins and mild acidity giving just enough support. The oak sticks out a bit, but beneath that layer is a rich fruity core.

title: Sierra Norte 2016 Porta Regia Colección Privada 5 Meses Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Solid plum and berry aromas lead to a fruity palate that's bouncy but not deep or layered. Candied berry flavors are satisfactory, but kind of basic. A flush finish closes out this varietal Monastrell.

title: Tenuta L'impostino 2014 Ottava Rima  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made with 60% Sangiovese and 40% Alicante, this opens with aromas of leather, baking spice and a hint of violet. The easygoing palate suggests red cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside smooth tannins.

title: Tormaresca 2015 Trentangeli Rosso Red (Castel del Monte)
description: Pleasing aromas of spiced bramble, anise and dark flowers give a good start to this wine. Medium in weight, with a mix of ripe and tart berries, this wine is well-balanced and well-structured but simplistic in its profile.

title: Tormaresca 2016 Chardonnay (Puglia)
description: Attractive in underripe peach and spry lemon aromas, the medium-bodied palate shows juicy melon and stone fruit flavors balanced by lemon-lime acidity. This is a crisp, refreshing Chardonnay, perfect for simple enjoyment.

title: Tormaresca 2017 Chardonnay (Puglia)
description: This wine is straightforward and rich in ripe tropical fruit aromas and flavors. Well-balanced acidity helps maintain freshness on the medium-bodied palate, leading to a crisp, clean finish.

title: Triacca 2014 Casa La Gatta  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This has subdued aroma suggesting forest floor, leather and a whiff of menthol. The light-bodied palate offers tart sour cherry, cranberry and a note of dark culinary spice alongside racy acidity.

title: Vega Sauco 2016 La Sonrisa del Nómada  (Toro)
description: Woody berry aromas are hot but also creamy and show vanilla notes. A bold, grabby palate delivers oaky flavors of prune, spice and chocolate. Some heat and aggressiveness must be dealt with on a firm finish.

title: Villa Pinciana 2015 Viognier (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, ripe apricot and butterscotch while the textured palate offers cedar, vanilla and lemon drop. It closes on a note of bitter almond.

title: Villa S. Anna 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Whiff of wild berry, moist earth and chopped herb aromas merge with a blue flower note. Suggestions of the nose carry over to the light-bodied delicate palate along with a hint of ground pepper. Bright acidity and dusty, not very persistent tannins provide gauzy support. Drink soon.

title: Villabella 2016  Lugana
description: Here's a refreshing wine with heady scents of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. It has a bright palate, offering white peach, yellow apple and a hint of crushed herb alongside tangy acidity.

title: Warwick 2015 The First Lady Cabernet Sauvignon (Western Cape)
description: Intriguing notes of curing spice, game, green pepper, coriander and cedar grace the black-fruit core of this Cab. The tannins are soft and approachable, while seductive notes of campfire and charred fruit skin unfold on the finish. Drink now.

title: Whitetail Ridge 2015 Müller-Thurgau (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is fresh, fruity and off dry, with a buttery smooth mouthfeel. There are mixed tree fruits and just enough acidity to offset the sweetness adequately. It's a perfect springtime sipping wine, low in alcohol, ripe with fruit flavor, and should be consumed over the next year or two.

title: William Heritage 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Outer Coastal Plain)
description: Fresh lemon juice freshens the richer aromas of butter cookie and caramelized sugar. The creamy mouthfeel gives way to bright, juicy pineapple, lemon curd and vanilla flavors, finishing crisp and fruity.

title: Carlos Serres 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: On first take, this smells oaky, with notes of animal fur and earthy berry fruits. A tight palate shows tomatoey acidity, while a narrow field of flavors includes plum and herbs. Drawing tannins and a minty flavor drive the finish on this basic but positive Rioja.

title: Château Baudan 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: This 18-acre estate has produced a wine with firm tannins and the potential for richness. From an old property that has been revived since the 1990s, the wine has many of the tannins typical of Listrac along with good fruit that will age well. Drink from 2023.

title: Boomtown 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of creamed corn, spice and baked apple lead to light, pleasant fruit flavors in this straightforward wine.

title: Château de la Brède 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 86–88. Barrel Sample. Ripe lime, apricot and pear flavors give this wine its rich, fruity character. Lightly textured, it has spice as well as generous fruits. It is developing quickly and should be ready from 2019.
